fraction
Class RatioInput

java.lang.Object
  fraction.RatioInput

public class RatioInput
extends java.lang.Object

Class to calculate fractions with the help of the console the input must be int the format (-)XX(/(-)XX) (+|-|*|/) (-)XX(/(-)XX)

Author:
Tobias Preuss (s0516424) & Niels Richter (s0517512)

workOnPart

private void workOnPart(java.lang.String[] part)
Extracts the integer-values of the given array of strings and writes it to the private integer values

Parameters:
part - array of strings in format {"(-)XX(/(-)XX)","(-)XX(/(-)XX)"}

workOnString

public int workOnString(java.lang.String s)
Needs a String in the form (-)XX(/(-)XX) (+|-|*|/|=|<|>) (-)XX(/(-)XX) and calls the workOnPart with an array of the parts

Parameters:
s - String to be converted
Returns:
an integer value of the operation 1 = +, 2 = -, 3 = *, 4 = /, 5 = =, 6 = >, 7 = <
